newsitem.title: USA: U.S. weekly rice cash market summary -- USDA.
newsitem.headline: U.S. weekly rice cash market summary -- USDA.

text.p: Rice prices were steady in the South, according to the weekly rice cash market summary from USDA.
Long grain milled rice prices were selling mostly at $20.00 per cwt, medium grain traded mostly at $18.00 to $19.00, second heads were steady and brewers were steady in tight supply.
Rice by-products were uneven, selling mostly steady.
In California, rice prices were steady with medium grain selling mostly from $18.00 to $19.00, second heads and bran were steady.
California rice ship loadings: In the week ended July 19, the Erimamthia loaded 5,000 mt of U.S. No. 1 medium grain milled rice destined for Turkey.
The remainder of the ship loaded paddy rice of a unknown quantity

Inspections of California rice for export: For the week ending July 19, there were 110,280 cwt of milled rice inspected. The yearly total since October 1, 1996 is 10,047,280 cwt compared to 6,992,387 cwt a year ago.
Feed by-products prices (dollars per short ton, FOB mills). Rice Bran 75.00-85.00 65.00-68.00 60.00-65.00 80.00
